title: Self-Service Cafeterias in the Czech Republic Published
text:
(MENAFN Press) As in 2013 the number of outlets of self-service cafeterias continued to decline in 2014. Self-service cafeterias faced increasing competition from fast food outlets and full-service restaurants which were attracting Czech customers with advantageous offers discount coupons and product innovations. In order to meet the competition from other players in foodservice independent self-service cafeterias such as Apetit and Country Life in Prague also attempted to attract Czech customers with...
Euromonitor International's Self-Service Cafeterias in Czech Republic report offers a comprehensive guide to the size and shape of the market at a national level. It provides foodservice sales the number of outlets and the number of transactions by sector allowing you to identify the foodservice sectors driving growth. It identifies the leading companies the leading brands and offers strategic analysis of key factors influencing the market - be they eating habits lifestyle changes tourism spending or legislative issues. Forecasts to 2019 illustrate how the market is set to change.
